intro: Hieracium olivaceum subsp. sublividifolium, commonly known as the olive-centred hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-orange composite flowers. The leaves are typically lanceolate and have a distinctive bluish-green hue on the underside. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant is noted for its finely divided foliage and is often found in temperate regions.
